member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.config.FormApp.SetUp
member.summary: The SetUp method creates required directories based on predefined paths. It checks whether each directory exists and creates it if it does not.
member.remarks: The following directories are processed: - CUAHANGXAYDUNG_DATA: Directory for construction store data. - VATLIEU_DATA: Directory for material data. - DOITAC_DATA: Directory for partner data. - TAIKHOAN_DATA: Directory for account data. If a directory already exists or the path is invalid, a debug message is logged.
member.exception: Throws an exception if an error occurs during directory creation.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.config.FormApp.GetConnectionString
member.summary: The GetConnectionString method generates and returns the SQL Server connection string based on the configured properties.
member.returns: A connection string in the format: "Data Source=<ServerName>;Initial Catalog=<DatabaseName>;User ID=<UserName>;Password=<Password>"
member.remarks: The following properties must be set before calling this method: - DATA_SOURCE: Name or address of the SQL Server. - DATABASE: Name of the target database. - USER_ID: SQL Server login username. - PASSWORD: Corresponding password for the USER_ID.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.model.VatLieu.GetDanhSachHinhAnhVatLieus
member.summary: Gets a list of image file paths in the specified folder.
member.returns: A list of full file paths for image files (e.g., .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .bmp, .gif) found in the folder. If the folder does not exist or an error occurs, returns an empty list.

member.name: T:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility
member.summary: Utilities related to file

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.CreateFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new folder at the specified path if it does not already exist.
member.param: The full path of the folder to create.
member.returns: Returns true if the folder was created; false if the folder already exists.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.GetImagePathsFromFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of image file paths from a specified folder. Supports file extensions: .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .bmp, .gif.
member.param: The path of the folder to search for image files.
member.returns: A list of full image file paths found in the folder.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.SaveImages(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves an image file to a specified target folder. If the folder does not exist, it will be created.
member.param: The full path of the image file to be copied.
The destination folder where the image should be saved.
member.remarks: This method checks whether the target folder exists and creates it if necessary. Then it attempts to copy the image file to the folder, overwriting it if a file with the same name already exists. Debug messages are written to help trace the execution flow and potential errors.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.DeleteFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a folder at the specified path along with all its contents.
member.param: The full path of the folder to delete.
member.returns: Returns true if the folder was successfully deleted; false if the folder does not exist or an error occurs during deletion.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.DeleteFile(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a file at the specified path if it exists.
member.param: The full path of the file to delete.
member.returns: Returns true if the file was successfully deleted; false if the file does not exist or an error occurs during deletion.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.WriteObjectJsonFile``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Writes an object of any type to a JSON file at the specified path.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to be written.
member.param: The object instance to serialize and write to the file.
The full file path where the JSON file will be saved, including the file name and extension.
member.returns: Returns true if the operation succeeds; otherwise, returns false if an error occurs.
member.remarks: If the directory does not exist, it will be automatically created. The object will be wrapped in a parent object with a "Data" property before being serialized. The JSON output will be indented for readability.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.AppendObjectToJsonFile``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Appends a new object to an existing JSON file that contains an array of objects.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to be appended.
member.param: The object instance to serialize and append to the JSON file.
The full path to the JSON file, including the file name and extension.
member.returns: Returns true if the object is successfully appended; returns false if the file doesn't exist, is not a valid JSON array, or if an error occurs.
member.remarks: The object will be wrapped in an anonymous object with a "Data" property before being added to the JSON array. If the JSON file is not a valid array, the method will log an error and return false.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.RemoveObjectFromJsonFile``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Removes all matching objects from a JSON file containing an array of objects wrapped in a "Data" property.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to be removed.
member.param: The object to find and remove from the JSON file.
The full path to the JSON file, including the file name and extension.
member.returns: Returns true if one or more matching entries were successfully removed; otherwise, returns false if no match was found, the file does not exist, or an error occurred.
member.remarks: This method assumes that each item in the JSON file is an object containing a "Data" property. The object to remove is serialized to JSON, and comparison is made using raw JSON string matching against the "Data" values. The updated JSON is written back to the file after removal.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.UpdateObjectInJsonFile``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Updates an existing object inside a JSON file where each object is wrapped in a "Data" property.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to be updated.
member.param: The object to update in the JSON file.
The full path to the JSON file, including file name and extension.
member.returns: Returns true if the object was found and updated; false if no matching entry was found, the file does not exist, or an error occurred.
member.remarks: This method assumes each item in the JSON file is an object containing a "Data" property. It matches the object to update by comparing the serialized JSON string of the "Data" property. If a match is found, the entry is replaced with the updated object and written back to the file.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.ExistsObjectInJsonFile``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a specific object exists in a JSON file, where each entry is wrapped in a "Data" property.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to check.
member.param: The object to search for in the JSON file.
The full path to the JSON file.
member.remarks: The method deserializes the JSON file into a list of elements, then checks each element's "Data" property for a match with the serialized form of .

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.ReadObjectsFromJsonFile``1(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a JSON file and deserializes its content into a list of objects of type .
member.typeparam: The type of objects to deserialize from the JSON file.
member.param: The full path to the JSON file.
member.returns: A list of objects of type . If the file does not exist or an error occurs, an empty list is returned.
member.remarks: The method assumes that the JSON file contains an array of objects, each having a property named "Data" that holds the actual object data. Example of expected JSON format: [ { "Data": { "Id": 1, "Name": "Item 1" } }, { "Data": { "Id": 2, "Name": "Item 2" } } ]

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.IsFileExists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a file exists at the specified file path.
member.param: The path of the file to check.
member.returns: True if the file exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.IsFileInFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a specified file is located within a given folder, including any of its subdirectories.
member.param: The full or relative path of the file to check.
The full or relative path of the folder to check against.
member.returns: Returns true if the file is located inside the specified folder or any of its subfolders; otherwise, returns false.
member.remarks: The method converts both and to their absolute (full) paths before comparison. A directory separator character is appended to the end of the folder path if it is not already present to avoid incorrect partial matching. If an exception occurs (e.g., invalid path), the method catches it and returns false.

member.name: M:QuanLyCuaHangVatLieuXayDung.utilities.FileUtility.DeleteAllFilesInFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes all files inside the specified folder.
member.param: The path to the folder whose files should be deleted.
member.returns: Returns true if all files were deleted successfully (or folder is empty); returns false if the folder doesn't exist or an error occurred.
member.remarks: This method only deletes files directly inside the specified folder. It does not delete subdirectories or their contents.
